author: Simon Difford
description: Some folk make this cocktail with honey syrup rather than maple syrup. Honey does indeed make for a tasty cocktail and is stipulated in the Brown Derby recipe that appears in George Buzza Jr.'s, 1933 Hollywood Cocktails. However, according to the 1930 The Savoy Cocktail Book, when made with honey this cocktail is a De Rigueur Cocktail.Whatever the name, I prefer this cocktail made with maple syrup, as unless you have a very full-bodied honey, maple syrup's 'tang' sits better with the bourbon and grapefruit combo.
name: Brown Derby

recipeInstructions.text: SHAKE all ingredients with ice and fine strain into chilled glass
